messages.title: Selly Oak Libraries threat
messages.content: Our Libraries are under threat. Birmingham's Labour council plan to cut £800,000 a year from the £6.5 million local libraries budget. They can't do this without closing libraries. Labour won't say which libraries will close until after the elections. But the figures suggest one or more of Selly Oak district's four libraries must close.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour plans to slash library budgets by 23%. Local Lib Dem Colin Green is campaigning to save them.

mentions.candidate: Colin Green is campaigning to save them.

leaflet.personalStatement: Only by showing Labour that you won't put up with them closing our libraries can they be saved.

images.caption: Local Lib Dem Colin Green is campaigning to save them.
